[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: Response<T>] [Large responses] Can extremely large Response<Vec<Transaction>> objects cause memory exhaustion when combined with State metadata, especially if the server sends unbounded pagination results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [Merkle root validation] Does Response provide any mechanism to cryptographically verify that the inner data matches the State's ledger version, or is the client forced to trust the REST server completely? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [Block height verification] Can clients verify that State.block_height actually corresponds to the claimed State.version through Merkle proofs, or could a malicious server provide fake metadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [State cloning] Since State implements Clone, can expensive cloning operations in high-frequency API calls cause performance degradation that could be exploited for client-side DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: Response] [Response cloning] If Response<T> is cloned (when T: Clone), can this create multiple owners of the same State leading to inconsistent updates if State were mutable elsewhere? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Function: into_parts()] [Tuple decomposition] When into_parts() separates inner and State, can developers incorrectly correlate unrelated data and State from different API calls, causing version confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [Version arithmetic] Can State.version overflow if used in arithmetic operations for computing version ranges, especially when comparing oldest_ledger_version and current version? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [Timestamp overflow] Can State.timestamp_usecs overflow in timestamp-based calculations, causing incorrect timeout computations or time-travel scenarios in client logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [Ordering implementation] Does State's Ord implementation correctly order blockchain states, or could incorrect comparison logic cause clients to process states out of order, breaking linearizability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Struct: State] [Equality semantics] Can State equality checks (Eq) produce false positives if cursor field is ignored, causing clients to treat different pagination states as identical? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/response.rs] [Usage Context] [Transaction submission] When submitting transactions, can stale State in Response<PendingTransaction> cause clients to wait for transactions at wrong versions, missing actual confirmations? (Medium)
